passages.text: Reporting calendar 2 Macroeconomic indicators 3 End- market data 5
See page 21 for analyst certification and important disclosures, including non- US analyst disclosures.

J.P. Morgan does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision.
Table 1: Upcoming reporting - J.P. Morgan European Business Services coverage
CompanyDateEarningsBunzl21st OctoberQ3 trading statementDCC11th NovemberH1 FY26 resultsDiploma18th NovemberFY25 resultsRS GroupTBCH1 FY26 results
Source: Company reports.
Overview of latest company reporting below.
· **Bunzl** - 26th August 2025 - 1H25: 1H25 in-line with pre-close statement. FY25 guidance reiterated and share buyback resumed link
· **DCC** - 10th July 2025 - 1Q26: 1Q26 in-line with expectations. FY26 guidance reiterated link
· **Diploma** - 17th July 2025 - 3Q25: Solid beat on 3Q25 organic, FY25 guidance upgrade link
· **RS Group** - 17th July 2025 - 1Q26: 1Q26 organic growth a touch below expectations with temporary impacts; FY26 guidance reiterated link
We summarise recent reporting and commentary from selected listed peers.
Table 2: Peer reporting - relevant comments

CompanyMost relevant forLast reporting dateNext reporting dateOrganic growthGuidanceIndustrial DistributorsFastenalRSDiplomaBunzl16th Jul13th OctQ2 8.6% (Q1 5.0%)For FY25, capital spending in a range of $250 million to $270 million (previously $265 million to $285 million)WW GrangerRSDiplomaBunzl1st Jul31st OctQ2 5.1% (Q1 4.4%)2025 Daily sales organic growth of 4.5%-6.0%; Gross margin 38.6%-38.9% down 80bps to 500bps y/y; Operating margin 14.7%-15.1% down 800bps to 400bps y/y with High-Touch Solutions - N.A. 16.5%-16.9% and EndlessAssortment 9.2%-9.6%.Wesco InternationalRSDiploma31st JulQ2 7.2% (Q1 5.6%)For FY-25, total organic sales 5%-7%, reported sales 4-6%, adj. EBITDA margin 6.6-6.8% down 300bps to 100ps y/yBossard HoldingRSDiploma22nd Jul14th OctQ2 -1.0% (Q1 -1.6%)MSC Industrial DirectRSDiploma1st JulQ2 -0.8% (Q1 -4.7%)ADS growth (0.5%)-1.5% y/y in Q3Adj op margin 8.5-9.0% in Q3Electronic DistributorsArrowRSDCC31st JulQ2 8.0% (Q1 -0.4%)3Q25: at constant currency, growth rate range of 5 to 13% y/y (-1 to +7% q/q) for global components and 4 to 14% y/y (-15% to -6 q/q) for global enterprise computing solutionsAvnetRSDCC6th AugQ2 -0.7% (Q1 -4.9%)For Q3-25, Sales $5.55-5.85bn and dil EPS $0.75-0.85T&YynexRSDCC24th JunQ2 6.3% (Q1 6.0%)For Q3-25, Revenue $14.7 to $15.5bn flat to up +5% y/y, adj dil EPS $2.75-3.25 down -4% to up 14% y/yEsprinetDCC13th MayQ1 +4% (Q4 +10%)LPG DistributorsUGI-International divisionDCC7th AugFerrellgasDCC6th JunRubisDCC5th May9th SepQ1 +2% (Q4 -2%)FY25 Group EBITDA expected to reach $710m to $760m down -2% to up +5% y/y
Source: Company data. Please note that Q2 represents the calendar quarter.
On the whole, the US has been stronger than Europe, with non- residential spend particularly strong, and industrial production improving sequentially. The US ISM has also stepped up sequentially.
The European data has been weak and PMIs are still in contraction territory, especially the new orders component, while the US PMI was down m/m in July, with the increase in the new orders component.
Figure 1: US manufacturing PMI, manufacturing PMI new orders, industrial production
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 3: US manufacturing PMI, manufacturing PMI new orders, industrial production - since 2022
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 2: EU manufacturing PMI, manufacturing PMI new orders, industrial production
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 4: EU manufacturing PMI, manufacturing PMI new orders, industrial production - since 2022
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.

Fastenal (FAST US, covered by JPM Analyst Patrick Baumann) is a US industrial distributor of fastening and safety products, which reports monthly sales data. The core Fastener business can be used as a bellwether for the wider health of US industrial demand. Fastener product sales improved sequentially from \(9.5\%\) in June to \(14.6\%\) in July.

Historically, average temperatures have been important for DCC, as LPG and oil are often used in off-grid residential or commercial heating. That said, the business' sensitivity to the weather has reduced materially over time.
Table 3:30/90-day temperature trends
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 24: France - 30d average temperature
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 25: UK - 30d average temperature
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Below, we show UK and French petrol prices at pump vs. wholesale, and the implied retailer margin.
Figure 26: UK Petrol prices at pump vs Wholesale price (p/l)
Source: J.P. Morgan estimates, Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 27: UK 3m Retailer/Distribution margin (p/l)
Source: J.P. Morgan estimates, Bloomberg Finance L.P.

Bunzl's end- markets have been largely resilient. End markets like Grocery, Healthcare or Cleaning & Hygiene have historically been defensive (apart from during COVID- 19), while Safety has been slightly more cyclical, given the exposure to construction end- markets.
Figure 7: Bunzl revenue by segment, FY24
Source: Company data.
Figure 8: Bunzl revenue by region, FY24
Source: Company data.
We estimate that c. \(30\%\) of Bunzl's raw materials are exposed to plastic, c. \(30\%\) to pulp and c. \(10\%\) to chemicals (cleaning & hygiene products).

In general, Bunzl does not increase prices directly to offset opex cost increases (e.g. higher warehousing or lorry driver costs) or use fuel surcharges. Instead, it relies on higher selling prices to offset these opex costs. After the successful renewal of Bunzl's Walmart contract under new terms, we estimate that only c. \(5\%\) of the Group has costplus arrangements, down from c. \(15\%\) previously.
The US plastic and paper PPIs are currently running \(- 2.8\%\) and \(+8.0\%\) respectively. Bunzl's price effect has tended to lag these indices by around six months.
Figure 9: US Plastic/Paper PPI (% y/y)
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 10: US Plastic/Paper PPI vs Bunzl price element (JPM)
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P., Company data.

While product prices are clearly sensitive to the price of raw materials, they also depend on other inputs, notably labour costs. As such, even as the product price indices have declined materially y/y, the selling prices of Bunzl's largest suppliers like Kimberley Clark or Essity have held up. From Q4- 24, Kimberley Clark has been reporting new reporting segments – North America, International Personal Care and International Family Care & Professional.
Figure 11: Kimberley Clark – Professional division – Net Price y/y
Source: Company reports.
Figure 12: Kimberley Clark – NA division – Net Price y/y
Source: Company reports.
Figure 13: Essity Professional Hygiene division – Price/Mix
Source: Company reports.
Sea freight rates have moderated from running up \(150\%\) y/y average in 2024 to down around \(- 54\%\) y/y last week.
Figure 14: SCFI over time
Source: Shanghai Shipping Exchange Shanghai (Export) Containerized Freight Index, Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 15: SCFI % change y/y
Source: Shanghai Shipping Exchange Shanghai (Export) Containerized Freight Index, Bloomberg Finance L.P.

US grocery retail sales minus PPI (proxy for volume) declined to \(- 1.2\%\) y/y in July from \(+0.8\%\) y/y in June. Foodservice sales less PPI improved at \(+1.1\%\) in July from \(+0.1\%\) in June.
Figure 16: US grocery and foodservice sales y/y
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 17: US grocery and foodservice sales less PPI (proxy for volume) y/y
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.

Fastenal's safety product organic trends were particularly useful for tracking Bunzl's COVID- 19- related sales during the pandemic, and are still relevant for Bunzl's safety business in North America.
Figure 18: Fastenal monthly sales: safety
Source: Company data.
Figure 19: Fastenal monthly sales: safety since 2022
Source: Company data.

Energy is the key focus in this section as we note that DCC has announced the divestment of its Healthcare and InfoTech businesses. In April 2025, DCC announced the sale of its Healthcare business for a total enterprise value of £1,050m on a cash- free and debt- free basis. The company also announced the divestment of its Info Tech business in July 2025 for a total enterprise value of c.£100m on a cash- free and debt- free basis.
In this section, we highlight key data points that we find useful in tracking DCC.
Figure 20: US natural gas liquids supplied
Figure 21: US biofuels product supplied
We also show monthly solar deployment statistics for the UK.
Figure 22: UK solar PV deployment
Source: UK government

In the UK in June 2025, out of the increase of 88MW m/m, 64MW was domestic (73%). Of the 2,104MW increase y/y, 657MW was domestic (31%). That means total MW increased 12% y/y in June, with domestic up 13% and other up 11% y/y.
Figure 23: UK solar PV deployment - domestic as % of total
Source: UK government, J.P. Morgan

Historically, average temperatures have been important for DCC, as LPG and oil are often used in off-grid residential or commercial heating. That said, the business' sensitivity to the weather has reduced materially over time.
Table 3:30/90-day temperature trends
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 24: France - 30d average temperature
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 25: UK - 30d average temperature
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Below, we show UK and French petrol prices at pump vs. wholesale, and the implied retailer margin.
Figure 26: UK Petrol prices at pump vs Wholesale price (p/l)
Source: J.P. Morgan estimates, Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 27: UK 3m Retailer/Distribution margin (p/l)
Source: J.P. Morgan estimates, Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 28: France Petrol prices at pump vs Wholesale price (€/kl)
Source: J.P. Morgan estimates, Bloomberg Finance L.P. France adjusted or subsidies
Figure 29: France 3m Retailer/Distribution margin (€cl)
Source: J.P. Morgan estimates, Bloomberg Finance L.P. France adjusted or subsidies
We also show European wholesale prices for propane (LPG) and heating oil below. Price fluctuations (esp. relative to natural gas) could in theory impact demand.
Figure 30: Propane prices European wholesale propane (€/MT)
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 31: Heating Oil prices
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
EMEA remains RS Group's largest division in terms of both revenue and profitability. We show a more granular revenue split by customer industry below.
Figure 32: RS Group revenue split by region FY25, %
Source: Company data.
Figure 33: RS Group revenue split by customer industry FY25, %
Source: Company data.
Industrial production growth was flat in 2023. In 2024 Industrial production was down \(1\%\) , although with China up \(5\%\) .
On the Electronics side, semiconductor billings have been recovering strongly in Americas and China, while they have also turned positive in May in Europe.
Table 4: RS Group monthly data summary
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.

RS Group's organic growth is chiefly driven by industrial production. RS Group's aim is to outperform industrial production by 1.5- 2.0x. Semiconductors account for \(Figure 34: RS Group organic vs. global semi sales
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P. Company reports.
Figure 35: RS Group organic vs US Industrial Production
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P. Company reports.

The best forward indicators for industrial production are the manufacturing PMIs. US new manufacturing orders were 47.1 in July from 46.4 in June and 47.6 in May. US industrial production was \(+1.4\%\) in July, after being \(+0.8\%\) y/y in June.
Figure 36: US new manufacturing order PMI vs Industrial production
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
In the UK, New Orders were down in July at 47.8 from 48.2 in June. Industrial Production was running \(+0.2\%\) y/y in June \((- 0.2\%\) in May).
Figure 37: UK new orders manufacturing PMI vs Industrial production
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
In Europe, New Orders were down to 49.0 in July from 49.5 in June. Industrial Production was \(+0.2\%\) y/y in June \((+3.1\%\) y/y in May).
Figure 38: Europe (ex-UK) new orders manufacturing PMI vs Industrial production
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 39: RS Group organic growth vs. US and EU manufacturing PMI
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P., Company data.
Semiconductor sales have recovered, led by North America, with Europe also turning positive.
Figure 40: Semiconductor sales, % y/y
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.

Over the years, Diploma has diversified its end markets so they now range from aerospace & defence OEMs to public service, data centers and healthcare laboratories, among other areas. Given the niche and broad nature of its end markets, Diploma is much more difficult to pinpoint the key end markets, but we provide a few examples by segment and some high level market trend charts in this section. Note that Diploma generates a significant portion of its revenue from North America (US and Canada).
1. Controls - aerospace & defence (interiors, fasteners), building automation, industrials, automotive (OEMs, formula one), marine, electronics, railroads, data centers, etc.
2. Seals - industrial equipment, automotive, aerospace & defence, energy, chemicals, agriculture, pharmaceuticals, etc.
3. Life Sciences - hospitals, clinics, laboratories, research facilities, etc.
Figure 41: Diploma revenue split by geography FY24, %
Source: Company data.
Figure 42: Diploma revenue split by sector FY24, %
Source: Company data.

Diploma's growth formula is focused on identifying high-quality acquisitions in profitable and growing niches with supportive secular tailwinds accelerating that growth and scaling the businesses over time. That said, Diploma's end markets have historically been beholden to the industrial cycle. We can see that since COVID, Diploma has markedly outperformed the PMI trends, though to a lesser extent after adjusting to include the US non-residential market.
Figure 43: Diploma's organic growth versus blended IP and US non-residential growth

Source: J.P. Morgan estimates, Bloomberg Finance L.P. Proportional impact based on geographical and market revenue contribution. Industrial production has been mixed across the key countries, with the US improving and the UK stable in July.

Construction spend in the US has remained stable in FY25 to date, however still down LSD% y/y. EU Aircraft maintenance spending (Diploma has some exposure via its Controls/Seals division) grew by \(8.9\%\) and \(4.5\%\) in June and May, respectively.
Table 5: Diploma monthly data summary

DiplomaRelevant division2023202431-Jan28-Feb31-Mar30-Apr31-May30-Jun31-JulIndustrial production-0.1%-1.7%-0.4%-0.8%-0.5%1.7%0.9%2.9%SwedenSeals - International1.5%-0.9%-1.1%-0.6%-2.1%6.7%3.4%14.0%United KingdomSeals - International / Controls-0.4%-1.2%-0.3%0.5%-0.1%0.8%-0.2%0.2%0.2%United StatesSeals - Industrial / OEM0.2%-0.3%1.4%1.1%1.1%1.3%0.8%0.8%1.4%GermanyControls-1.6%-4.4%-1.7%-4.3%-0.7%-2.1%-0.2%-3.6%Construction spend9.2%2.5%1.2%0.0%0.0%0.5%0.6%CanadaSeals - Aftermarket / Control (WCW)-1.4%-0.3%2.6%1.1%1.0%1.9%1.9%USSeals - Aftermarket / Control (WCW)19.8%5.3%-0.2%-1.1%-1.1%-1.0%-0.7%-0.5%-0.5%EU aircraft maintenance spendControls8.8%17.3%13.1%7.7%11.1%8.1%4.5%8.9%
Source: J.P. Morgan estimates.Bloomberg Finance L.P.

Accounting for \(47\%\) of group revenues (with Windy City Wire the key business), the Controls division primarily supplies specialised wiring, cable, connectors, fasteners, control devices, adhesives, and CNC and robotic components that are used in a range of technically demanding applications.

We see that US non- residential construction spending was strong through 2023 and slowed down throughout 2024 to around MSD- HSD% growth. In 2025 YTD, we have seen a LSD% decline. However, the US construction spending within the public safety segment has been particularly strong, with the market up LSD% yoy. Similarly, the
Figure 44: Diploma's Control organic growth
Source:J.P.Morgan estimates,Company data.
Figure 46: US private domestic non-residential investment
Source:Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 48: Euro area repair & maintenance of aircraft & spacecraft YoY
Source:Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 45: US residential and non-residential construction spend YoY
Source:Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 47: US construction spending (public safety)
Source:Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 49: US PPI aircraft and maintenance repair/services YoY
Source:Bloomberg Finance L.P.

Accounting for 35% of group revenues, the Seals division primarily supplies a range of seals, gaskets, cylinders, components and kits used in heavy mobile machinery and a diverse range of fluid power products with aftermarket, OEM and MRO application.

Destocking has had a negative impact on organic growth in Seals. Looking at the US manufacturing & trade inventories data, we see some slight improvement on the data, which is also in line with management's comments around some green shoots within destocking.
Figure 50: Diploma's Seals organic growth
Source: J.P. Morgan estimates, Company data.
Figure 51: UK industrial production repair and installation of machinery & equipment
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 52: US manufacturing & trade inventories MoM
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 53: Defense price consumption expenditures (aircraft, missiles, ships) index
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.

Accounting for 18% of group revenues, the Life Sciences division primarily supplies a range of medical devices, consumables, instrumentation and related services to the healthcare and environmental end markets, sourced primarily under long- term agreements. Geographically, Diploma is present in Canada (42% of revenue), Europe (39% of revenue) and Australasia (19% of revenue).

We take a look at the Canadian inventory value of the medical equipment and supplies market and see that the market has indeed gone through a period of normalisation post COVID- 19. While this appears to be continuing, the magnitude of the normalisation is materially less than before.
Figure 54: Diploma's Life Sciences organic growth
Figure 55: Canadian inventory value of medical equipment and supplies YoY
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Below, we show 24- month forward P/E multiples for the four distribution companies we cover, compared to their historical medians.
Figure 56: Bunzl 24m forward P/E
Figure 57: DCC 24m forward P/E
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 58: RS Group 24m forward P/E
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 59: Diploma 24m forward P/E
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Below we show how RS Group and Diploma trade compared to two US Industrial distribution peers, namely Fastenal and WW Grainger.
Figure 60: RS Group and Diploma compared with US peers: 24-month forward P/E multiples 24m fwd PE
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
We show Diploma's valuation compared with a group of Nordic companies with similar decentralised M&A characteristics.
Figure 61: Diploma vs Nordic decentralised peers: 24-month forward P/E multiples
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
We also show the spread between the UK distributors' earnings yield (the reverse of the P/E) and the UK government 10- year yield.
Figure 62: Diploma 24m forward earnings yield vs. UK 10YR yield
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 63: Bunzl 24m forward earnings yield vs. UK 10YR yield
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 64: DCC 24m forward earnings yield vs. UK 10YR yield
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Figure 65: RS Group 24m forward earnings yield vs. UK 10YR yield
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.

Companies Discussed in This Report (all prices in this report as of market close on 28 August 2025, unless otherwise indicated) Bunzl(BNZL.L/2,490p/NR), DCC(DCC.L/4,696p/NR), Diploma PLC(DPLML.L/5,430p/N), RS GROUP PLC(RS1R.L/570p/N)

The chart(s) show J.P. Morgan's continuing coverage of the stocks; the current analysts may or may not have covered it over the entire period. J.P. Morgan ratings or designations: OW = Overweight, N = Neutral, UW = Underweight, NR = Not Rated

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex-Australia and ex-India) and U.K. small- and mid-cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P. Morgan's Research website, https://www.jpmorganmarkets.com.

Coverage Universe: So, Karin : Adecco (ADEN.S), Befesa (BFSA.DE), Bunzl (BNZL.L), Bureau Veritas (BVI.PA), DCC (DCC.L), Diploma PLC (DPLM.L), Elis (ELIS.PA), Experian plc (EXP.N.L), Intertek (ITRK.L), RS GROUP PLC (RSI.R.L), Randstad (RAND.AS), Rentokil Initial (RTO.L), SGS (SGSN.S), SPIE (SPIE.PA), Securitas (SECUb.ST), Serco Group (SRPL), Teleperformance (TEPRF.PA)
